Headline: Chemicals, AI enthusiast, Strategy, Investor, 3x Entrepreneur, Ivy League
Comment: Avik Ashar while it is correct that revenues on annual contracts should be amortized monthly for a realistic picture, however most of the financing and taxation (GST, TDS etc) is done on the basis of invoice. For sectors dependent on bank debt for working capital or term loans, often the headline YTD revenues is an important metric for decision making. Similarly, for capital raising purposes, the YTD revenues (based on invoicing) flows into ARR calculations (though on deep dive, the true picture get uncovered). I recommend that one should show two sets of financials - 1) based on invoicing and 2) based on amortization of revenues and expenses over the year to give a complete picture.
